| dykdate = 3 March 2010 | dykentry = that '''[[Operation Sandblast]]''' was the [[Code name|code name]] for the first submerged circumnavigation of the world executed by the [[USS Triton (SSRN-586)|USS ''Triton'']] in 1960? }} {{WPMILHIST|class=A|Maritime=yes|US=yes|Cold-War=yes|A-Class=pass}} {{WPSHIPS|class=A}} {{OnThisDay|date1=2011-04-25|oldid1=425752536|date2=2014-04-25|oldid2=605767132}}
==Article launch== Article duly launched.[[User:Marcd30319|Marcd30319]] ([[User talk:Marcd30319|talk]]) 16:29, 24 February 2010 (UTC) ==Future improvements== Associated wiki-article to be written are:
* [[1960 Paris Summit]], which also includes the following articles: [[1960 U-2 incident]], [[1960]], [[1960 in the United States]], [[Anastas Mikoyan]], [[Thing (listening device)]], [[Special Relationship]], [[List of United States – Soviet Union summits]], [[Berlin Crisis of 1961]], [[May 1960]], [[Khrushchev Thaw]], [[Bob Considine]], [[Harold Macmillan]], [[May 16]], [[USS Jonas Ingram (DD-938)]], [[Robert Rothschild]], [[Nikita Khrushchev]], [[Cold War (1953–1962)]], [[Timeline of events in the Cold War]], [[Thomas S. Gates, Jr.]] * [[Evan P. Aurand]], which also includes the following article: [[Ralph E. Williams]]. * [[Lawrence R. Daspit]], which also includes the following articles: [[Daspit Glacier]], [[List of military figures by nickname]], [[List of nicknames of historical personages]], [[ComSubLant]], [[USS Triton (SSRN-586)]], [[USS Tinosa (SS-283)]]. * [[Operation Northern Trident 2009]], which also includes the following articles: [[HMAS Sydney (FFG 03)]], [[HMAS Ballarat (FFH 155)]], [[Operation Sandblast]]. * [[Ding Yiping]], which also includes the following articles: [[People's Liberation Army Navy Organization]] and [[Chinese submarine 361]]. * [[Wallace M. Beakley]], which also includes the following articles: [[Jerauld Wright]], [[United States Seventh Fleet]], [[Gray Eagle Award]]. * [[Reuben T. Whitaker]], which also includes the following articles: [[USS Flasher (SS-249)]] and [[Joint Army-Navy Assessment Committee]] * [[Edward C. Stephan]]

==A-Class Review== [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Military_history/Assessment/Operation_Sandblast A-Class Review Page]. [[User:Marcd30319|Marcd30319]] ([[User talk:Marcd30319|talk]]) 18:25, 23 March 2010 (UTC)
== Who circumnavigated submerged without a periscope/snorkle? ==
I'd like to know, so maybe a link or something <small class="autosigned">— Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/1.178.166.233|1.178.166.233]] ([[User talk:1.178.166.233|talk]]) 11:21, 12 August 2015 (UTC)</small><!-- Template:Unsigned IP --> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->
== Slow driving costs more? ==
From the [[Operation_Sandblast#Mission_origins|article]], we have: :''Admiral Burke's classified response dated 18 January 1960 acknowledged the technical feasibility of Project Magellan while further noting that the "Magellan route" could be transited in "56 days at 20 knots (37 km/h; 23 mph) and 75 days at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)," with the latter option costing an additional $3.34 million USD in nuclear fuel consumed.''
Surely this cannot be correct? Travelling faster through the water consumes less fuel? --[[User:Skyring|Pete]] ([[User talk:Skyring|talk]]) 06:38, 29 August 2015 (UTC)
::That's what the sourcing stated. I suspect that has to back-end cost of refueling ''Triton'' earlier than later.[[User:Marcd30319|Marcd30319]] ([[User talk:Marcd30319|talk]]) 13:41, 16 April 2016 (UTC)
== External links modified ==
Hello fellow Wikipedians,
I have just added archive links to {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Operation Sandblast]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=702422403 my edit]. If necessary, add {{tlx|cbignore}} after the link to keep me from modifying it. Alternatively, you can add {{tlx|nobots|deny{{=}}InternetArchiveBot}} to keep me off the page altogether. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/20090417152238/http://www.spinax.com:80/Newsletter/Newsletter%2051/Albacore.htm to http://www.spinax.com/Newsletter/Newsletter%2051/Albacore.htm
When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' to let others know.
{{sourcecheck|checked=true}}
Cheers.—[[User:Cyberbot II|<sup style="color:green;font-family:Courier">cyberbot II]]<small><sub style="margin-left:-14.9ex;color:green;font-family:Comic Sans MS">[[User talk:Cyberbot II|<span style="color:green">Talk to my owner]]:Online</sub></small> 14:03, 30 January 2016 (UTC)
